description.narrative: To develop and implement SDG integration services and policy support at scale throughout GPN by working closely with country offices to respond to complex, interdependent and ambiguous challenges at the country level.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade of the Republic of korea
THE WILLIAM AND FLORA HEWLETT FOUNDATION

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1.1 Number of Countries that have tested and/or used innovative tools for integrated policy and SDGs acceleration 1.2 Number of south-south or triangular initiatives implemented through SDGI convening actions 1.3 Number of Publications and knowledge products showcasing evidence and data analytics aligned to policy 1.4 Number, type and scope of normative guidance and learning actions developed with UNDP direct contribution (including SDG Integration tool kits, SoPs, RR guidance, etc) measured by reach/ use/ feedback/country /theme) 1.5 Level of integration narrative fed into GPN technical teams’, COs/Reg Hubs and BERA’s communications (stories, messaging, videos etc), measured by # of stories, posts, reach and engagement. (Activity 3) 1.6 OECD-UNDP Global Hub for the Governance is established and operational, list of CO pilot identified and rolled out (Activity 4) 1.7 Number of countries that received support on SDG follow-up and review, including through VNR and SDGR processes and targeted support on data and statistical capacity (Activity 5 and 6) - 29 1.8 The number of country cases (“integrated solutions map”) and country stories grow on the SDG Integration website, measured by # of cases and stories, # views, and reach and engagement in social media. (Activity 7)

1.1 Number of Countries that have tested and/or used innovative tools for integrated policy and SDGs acceleration -tbd 1,2 Number of south-south or triangular initiatives implemented through SDGI convening actions-0 1.3 Number of Publications and knowledge products showcasing evidence and data analytics aligned to policy-3 1.4 Number, type and scope of normative guidance and learning actions developed with UNDP direct contribution (including SDG Integration tool kits, SoPs, RR guidance, etc) measured by reach/ use/ feedback/country /theme) -2 1.5 Level of integration narrative fed into GPN technical teams’, COs/Reg Hubs and BERA’s communications (stories, messaging, videos etc), measured by # of stories, posts, reach and engagement. (Activity 3) -5 1.6 OECD-UNDP Global Hub for the Governance is established and operational, list of CO pilot identified and rolled out (Activity 4) -0 1.7 Number of countries that received support on SDG follow-up and review, including through VNR and SDGR processes and targeted support on data and statistical capacity (Activity 5 and 6) - 2 1.8 The number of country cases (“integrated solutions map”) and country stories grow on the SDG Integration website, measured by # of cases and stories, # views, and reach and engagement in social media. (Activity 7) - cases-5; stories - 2

1.1 Integrated approaches and tools were supported in 39 countries and regions through the global campaign on ‘Integrated SDG Solutions’ 1.3 - COVID Impact on the SDGs study (flagship 1, launched in December 2020) - Data Futures Platform 1.4.MAPS e-course which had 311 people enrolled from 159 countries; IFs trainings 1.5. Links to the integration narrative were added to the global website undp.org, as well as on all COs and Regional Hub sites. BERA provided robust support to the SDG launches (global campaign on ‘integrated solutions, launch of the COVID impact study, launch of the Data Futures Platform). Mention of the integration narrative and links to the SDGi site increased [but this can’t be quantified due to lack of data] 1.7 Through the data and analytics team and newly launched Data Futures Platform, a number of country offices were supporting on an ad-hoc basis for data and statistical support. The VNR engagement was no longer managed by the SDGi team after 2019. 1.8 New cases: 29 (total number: 29) New stories: 17 (total number: 28) The site reached 100K users (8% growth compared to 2019), 126K sessions (11% growth) and 242K page views (61% growth). The dedicated @SDGintegration Twitter handle garnered an engagement rate of 1.6% (growth by 44% compared to 2019), 1.7 million impressions (6% growth), 47K profile visits and 1,648 new followers (growth by 52%).

1.1 Number of Countries that have tested and/or used innovative tools for integrated policy and SDGs acceleration -tbd 1.2 Number of south-south or triangular initiatives implemented through SDGI convening actions-3 1.3 Number of Publications and knowledge products showcasing evidence and data analytics aligned to policy-3 1.4 Number, type and scope of normative guidance and learning actions developed with UNDP direct contribution (including SDG Integration tool kits, SoPs, RR guidance, etc) measured by reach/ use/ feedback/country /theme) -2 1.5 Level of integration narrative fed into GPN technical teams’, COs/Reg Hubs and BERA’s communications (stories, messaging, videos etc), measured by # of stories, posts, reach and engagement. (Activity 3) -6 1.6 OECD-UNDP Global Hub for the Governance is established and operational, list of CO pilot identified and rolled out (Activity 4) -5 Number of countries that received support on SDG follow-up and review, including through VNR and SDGR processes 1.7 and targeted support on data and statistical capacity (Activity 5 and 6) - 5 1.8 The number of country cases (“integrated solutions map”) and country stories grow on the SDG Integration website, measured by # of cases and stories, # views, and reach and engagement in social media. (Activity 7) - cases-7; stories - 5

1.1 - 2 General International Futures model Trainings - 2 specialized International Futures model training sessions for 1) Guatemala and 2) Costa Rica and Peru - CLEWs Asia Pacific training course - National CLEWs training workshop: Cameroon - Summer School on Modelling Tools for Sustainable Development – CLEWs track - Building capacities in the use of modelling tools for policy coherence in Nicaragua 1.2 - Managed CGE modelling training with 5 economists across Africa whose work supported the relevant UNDP COs - Ran impact evaluations with 10 Cos and held learning sessions with other Cos - Tested and implemented hyperlocal vaccine analysis with 5 COs 1.3 COVID Impact on the SDGs study (flagship 2, LNOB focus launched in April 2021) 1.4 - Revised SDG acceleration toolkit. - IFs training (see first indicator for details) - CLEWS training (see first indicator for details) - 17 Data Thursdays learning sessions - Transformation Literacy training series 1.5 Links to the integration narrative were kept on the global website undp.org, as well as on all COs and Regional Hub sites. In addition, the SDG Integration Offer was more prominently featured on the new revamped corporate website. BERA accepted without exception all requests to promote SDGi content in social media (Twitter and LinkedIn) - a strong improvement compared to previous years. Mention of the integration narrative and links to the SDGi site kept increasing through stories posted on the corporate site [but this can’t be quantified due to lack of data] 1.7 The data and analytics team supported a number of Cos through ad-hoc data and statistics support, and has reached 122 Country Offices through the weekly Data Thursdays learning series, launched in August 2021. 1.8 New cases: 1 + revamped all existing 29 cases (total number: 30). 100 new tools in the ‘Knowledge Bank’. New stories: 5 (total number: 33) The team also met its goal of reaching outside of UNDP channels with editorial pieces and published op-eds and blogs on WEF Agenda, the UN News site and the Columbia University blog – and is currently finalizing an agreement with the World Economic Forum to feature content on their Strategic Intelligence website (coming in 2022). In 2021, the SDG integration website continued to grow, reaching 134K users, 172K sessions and 280K page views which represents a growth by 34, 37 and 16 % respectively compared to last year. The site also maintained its strong geographical spread, as the top ten user countries consistently covered four continents as well as an even balance between donor and program countries. The dedicated @SDGintegration Twitter handle garnered an engagement rate of 1.3% (slight drop compared to last year), 3.3 million impressions (growth by 100%), 197K profile visits (growth by over 300%) and 2,000 new followers (growth by 38%)

(Activity 7) - cases-7; stories - 5
